product.title: It's Not Easy Being Big | Book Club by Early Moments
product.text:
It's Not Easy Being Big!
by Stephanie St. Pierre

Children sometimes feel small, especially when mom and dad and everyone else, for that matter, seem so much bigger. It's Not Easy Being Big! is an easy-to-read introduction into spatial relationships starring Big Bird, Elmo, and the Sesame Street gang. In the end, young readers will find out that it is okay to be small or tall. It's Not Easy Being Big! is a nice way to help little ones see the value in themselves—exactly as they are now.

Tie-in Activity: Help your child understand size relationships. Start with two different-sized balls large enough for your child to handle, such as a tennis ball and beach ball. Ask her to roll you the small ball, or have her kick the big ball. Allow her to direct you, asking for the different balls—and have a ball!
